reviews.review_msg: This class is normally ran in seminar format, but I took it in a lecture format, so your could tell Bouchard was a little under prepared for the different style in teaching. He tried to create a lot of class discussion but in a lecture that is not really appropriate. He brought in some guest speakers that were pretty cool.
This class was online and was entirely ran by the TA. It was pretty easy as I put in next to know effort and got a B+ so I recommend taking this class for an upper division crim credit.

Class was run by the TA, zero contact with prof. Other than that, was a decent run-of-the-mill course. Three readings per week, and study questions. Quizzes every two weeks based off study questions. Weekly discussions, a 3 page paper, and 10-page final paper. "...Not great not terrible" - Dyatlov, HBO Chernobyl.

Took both 464 and 453 with him in the same semester. The class was completely run by TA's - did not have any contact with him. Only doing this review for the classes - they are both straight forward and set up the exact same way. A final paper, a paper outline, weekly discussions and quizzes every 2nd week. Were not very engaging courses.

I had Dr. Bouchard for an online course. You would think in the era of COVID that profs would make themselves accessible when their name is on the course. But he did not and was condescending when other students had emailed him. The course ended up being completely run by TAs. There was some leniency with deadlines but no interaction.
Martin is the hottest prof at SFU. His course is tough and requires a lot of participation but his lectures are interesting and participation heavy. He cares about his students.

In the four years I've been at SFU, Dr. Martin Bouchard is definitely a prof I would recommend. He's funny, energetic, caring, and you actually walk away learning some pretty interesting stuff. In all honesty, you'd have to be a complete fool to fail his class - he makes lectures interesting and makes coming to school worth it! Take his class!

Great prof, lectures are interesting and engaging most of the time. Participation is worth a lot so don't take his class if you don't want to come to class and contribute. Very very easy marker, it's not tough to do well

Lots of work required for this course-weekly readings & graded on participation in lectures. His multiple choice tests are difficult. However, his lectures are fairly interesting & Martin is smoking hot.

Taken in class and I don't think I learned anything about gangs. It's hard to participate when the lecture has no structure and you cannot follow his train of thought. The papers were easy enough but don't expect to use lecture content  in them. Weekly quizzes and participation marks are the only reason to attend the class.

Took in class. Bad choice. As intelligent as he is, he does not make for a good professor. Did not have any structure to his classes at all... besides the weekly quizzes. He tends to ramble and is hard to understand. I did not learn anything... There were two term papers that were based on things that were hardly touched on in class. What? Avoid.

Very chill online class. You have weekly discussions that are worth 20% of your grade. To get full marks for discussions, state your discussion and reply to 3 other people's. You have a quiz every second week where questions come from the list of study questions based on the readings 20% of your grade is your term paper outline & 40% for the paper

Amazing guy, always ready and willing to help, especially if you visit in office hours. However, lots of reading required for the class and he really makes you work for your mark. Hilarious guy, you won't regret it.

took this course online, 2 essays, online discussion and one final. But the hardest part is that the final consists of TWO essay questions, so i didnt even know how to study for it. Wouldnt recommend it.

Took 453 & 459 in the same semester with Bouchard. He is outstanding, very knowledgeable, and cares about his students. His classes require a lot of effort and are not easy, but if you do the weekly readings, participate, and put a lot of time into the term paper you'll be fine. Lots of laughs from his unique sense of humour. Highly recommend.

Martin is a great professor. He is very interested in the work he does and extremely knowledgeable. His class is NOT easy. He expects a high level of academic work from each one of his students. But he will ensure that you walk out of his class having learned something and he will always lend help or guidance if you need it
Not easy but if you put some honest work into it, you'll be fine. He's really funny and easy on the eyes. Probably one of my favorite criminology professors of all time.

Definitely not an easy Prof. Don?t takes his class if you expect not to do anything and get a good grade.  Other than that, he is an amazing teacher for those who genuinely try and come to class prepared. His lectures are interesting and he is really knowledgeable.  Very funny and keeps everyone enticed. One of the best teachers by far.

Had Martin for 131 and am taking 453 and 459 with him this semester. The classes are fair. If you expect to show up half the time and read half the material, you won't do well. Go to class and read and you will. He is extremely interesting and funny; one of the best profs I've had. For the ladies, you won't be disappointed. Recommend highly!

Great professor! He is young, funny, relevant, and (for the ladies) good looking. On the surface the class seems very easy because of the material, but his marking scheme is very specific. The key is memorization. Use your textbook! He repeats a lot of information. Attend lectures, he doesn't post notes and they are very useful. I got an A.

Extremely funny, informative lectures, and very clear what he wants. Exams are a bit tough, and this is no "easy-A" class (busted my ass for an A-). However, if one is a good student, should have no problem getting a reflective grade. As a guy, I can safely say I enjoyed the class despite all the girls who adored him. Take it for a great class!

Martin is wonderful. He is very understanding of his students needs and tries to relax through his french canadian humour. His midterm required a lot of memorization and his final was a mix of memorization and mostly applying your knowledge. Super hot quebecois <3
He is gorgeous and funny. The class is interesting because he is able to bring his humour into the lectures.
gorgeous. wanna wrap myself up in his arms. je t'aime m. bouchard!!

Isn't very clear on expectations. An extremely high level of participation is needed to achieve over 50%. Does not enforce his own guideline requirements. No final is a plus, but found class disorganized and prof not very helpful. Much better if Bouchard teaches a larger class like 220, he's a great lecturer and TA's can clarify obscure criteria
He's so hot! OMGZ he has the cutest accent and has cute funny/sarcastic jokes. He makes the class SO interesting and he is just overall awesome prof! HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM!

Come on. He's hot. Enough said. Other than that he's incredibly interesting and smart. Our class was basically just a weekly discussion on things we thought were interesting about the articles we'd read which was a great format. Great teacher and great to look at.
This class is my favorite and plus hes soo hot. His french accent is so cute. He makes the class alot more interesting with his little jokes.
Teacher is really great and CUTE!

I loved this class. He was fair and made it interesting to be there. You had to read all that was given to you but it wasn't impossible to do and I found myself looking forward to class. It wasn't an easy course but his teaching style made it enjoyable
He was helpful even after I finished the course. He was very kind about returning papers (unlike many other profs I know). His extra effort makes you feel even better about showing up to lectures.

Martin is a great prof, very fair on assignments and exams. Mark breakdown was a bit weird - 5% each for two assignments, 40% for the proposal, 20% for the midterm, 30% for the final - small assignments are designed to prepare you for proposal, but end up taking a lot of time. Overall, amazing prof, I would definitely take a class with Martin again
This guy is a hot tamale.  He coordinated his outfits with his lecture slides!  Teaching is good, has a cute little French accent.  His exams were fair and easy.  Extremely helpful and approachable.
can't keep my eyes off of him...makes the class that much more interesting! definitely take it!

This class is really boring and all it is, is pretty much theory. The course is super dry and unexciting but the one bonus of this class is that the prof is so frickin hot. Also the prof is really helpful with his slides and he's a good lecturer. Take his classes, he's for sure the hottest prof I've ever had!!

It shows that he takes his job very seriously by the awesome slides that he makes for class. And that he dresses accordingly to what colour his slides are. :) He makes class interesting and just like everyone else have said; he's not bad looking either.

He's definitely easy on the eyes. I always attend his class and every time I'm there, I just want to sit closer to the front. I am sitting closer and closer to the front. :) Clear notes, endearing French accent, and an overall very patient person makes him one of my favourite profs at SFU. Have I mentioned that he's very good looking? :D
He is very easy to look at, and I always wanted to sit near the front of the class.  He is very energetic, and clear in what he expects.  I'd hit it.
Martin is a really good prof. his notes are clear and he a really nice guy. His exams are totally fair. everything on the test was mentioned in class. HE is definately nice to look at!

he was a very easy teacher. he had a french accent but he was so pretty to look at that you just wouldnt want to miss his lecture. overall it was my first semester and i would say he was a easy prof and one of the best ones i had. he told you exactly wat to study for midterms and the final and wat he said was on it. BEST TEACHER TO HAVE!!
